topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540ca5e2636872154a380100#post_540ca5e2636872154a380100
British news papers are the equivalent of US based 24 hour news channels in that they're all constantly competing to be the most sensational and attention grabbing. Some due this by pandering to political bias (like MSNBC and Fox News) others by latching onto anything even vaguely shocking and then hyping it up to its most extreme possible lengths (like literally every major US news outlet).

Now, in this case the story is probably true. The Daily Mail is in no way exaggerating the claims of Dr. Jari Louhelainen who has been apparently talking to everyone about this (just read interviews he gave with a couple other newspapers and listened to one he gave on BBC radio), however I'd still advise against taking anything printed in a British newspaper with more than a grain of salt.

My reason? Well simply that this story happens to hit all the highlights they look to for clickbait. Its about horrible murder, and an unsolved mystery. The only way it could be more right up their alley was if they could somehow work pedophilia and the decay of society at the hands of X (X being literally anything not completely British) into it.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540cab3a6368724408510100#post_540cab3a6368724408510100
oh I know how biased they are. Which is why I am not perturbed by the Mail. If I recall correctly the other papers are state owned and tried their own scaremongering with UKIP (usual stuff: racist, homophobic, sexist) and did not report Rotherham (which is more disgusting than anything the mail has done imo).
And to be honest, the new information about most of ISIS's foreign combatants being from Britain has shaken my previous positions on the role of multiculturalism.

And I googled the scientist a bit and saw that the story seemed legit. And if it wasn't he could go to another paper who would run the story to get clickbait bashing the mail.

We'll know for sure if its legit or not eventually. Currently I'm leaning towards legit with some skepticism held because I haven't yet read or heard of anyone going behind the guy and checking his work and don't know nearly enough about the actual science to make any claims otherwise.

I don't believe the UK has state owned papers, but I cannot swear to that.
